author: Asian News International
title: PM Modi accepts invitation to inaugurate Abu Dhabiâ€™s Hindu temple
text: New Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accepted the invitation extended by Swami Ishwarcharandas and Swami Brahmaviharidas, along with the board of directors for the inauguration of the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi on February 14 next year, BAPS Swaminarayan Sanstha said in a press statement. PM Modi and the BAPS Swami Ishwarcharandas met on Wednesday at the Prime Ministerâ€™s residential office and PM Modi graciously accepted the invitation, expressing his enthusiastic support for the historic and iconic temple. Swami Ishwarcharandas honoured the Prime Minister by adorning him with a garland and draping a saffron shawl over his shoulders, acknowledging his significant contributions to our nation and the world. The Prime Minister was specially commended for the remarkable renovation and development of pilgrimage sites across India, a feat unparalleled in recent centuries, said the press statement. During the meeting, the discussions revolved around Abu Dhabi templeâ€™s significance for global harmony and Modiâ€™s vision for Indiaâ€™s spiritual leadership on the global stage. The release read, â€œThe BAPS delegation prayed for the Prime Ministerâ€™s health and acknowledged his exceptional global achievements, notably strengthening relationships with the UAE and other Middle Eastern countries. They also discussed the pride and inspiration Modiâ€™s leadership has instilled in Indians worldwide.â€ Recalling his personal and immortal memories of Pramukh Swami Maharaj and his glorious centenary celebrations, the Prime Minister expressed prayers for Mahant Swami Maharajâ€™s health. PM also appreciated the efforts of key individuals, volunteers, and supporters, involved in the BAPS Hindu Mandir project in Abu Dhabi, including those present before him such as Chairman Ashok Kotecha, Vice Chairman Yogesh Mehta, and Director Chirag Patel, recognizing their contributions as significant sources of pride for India. In a light-hearted exchange, the Prime Minister asked Chirag Patel about his love for tennis and his father Rohitbhai Patel, and grandfather P D Patel; and also encouraged his children to continue working hard and achieve success in the sport. As per the press statement, Swami Brahmaviharidas showcased the latest update of the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi, emphasizing its intricate carvings and all-inclusive grandeur, saying that â€œthe inauguration ceremony will be a great event, a millennial moment of celebration for time to come.â€ To which PM Modi added, â€œIt will reflect the ideal of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam â€“ an ideal spiritual space, not merely rooted in beliefs and traditions, but a confluence of diverse cultures and civilizations. The essence of spiritual harmony, symbolizing the path forward.â€ (Except for the headline, the story has not been edited by Siasat staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)

author: cristiano.faria@zerozero.pt (RedaÃ§Ã£o)
title: De La Fuente sobre Yamal: Â«Vai ser uma lenda do futebolÂ»
text:
Em contagem decrescente para o embate entre a Espanha e os PaÃ­ses Baixos, Luis De La Fuente aproveitou a conferÃªncia de imprensa de antevisÃ£o Ã  partida para tecer rasgados elogios dirigidos a Lamine Yamal.
Â«Tem condiÃ§Ãµes para ser um futebolista diferente. Qualidade, autoconfianÃ§a, valentia... mas tambÃ©m lembro sempre que tem 17 anos, estÃ¡ em processo de formaÃ§Ã£o e falta-lhe muito caminhoÂ», comeÃ§ou por referir o selecionador espanhol.
Â«Vamos fazer de tudo para que nÃ£o seja difÃ­cil para ele. Se Deus quiser, vai ser uma lenda do futebol, dos que marcam uma Ã©pocaÂ», garantiu em jeito de conclusÃ£o sobre o craque do Barcelona.
A cumprir a segunda temporada completa com as cores blaugrana, Lamine Yamal soma 13 golos e 17 assistÃªncias em 38 jogos. JÃ¡ ao serviÃ§o de La Roja, o extremo soma jÃ¡ 17 internacionalizaÃ§Ãµes e trÃªs golos.
aquio PaÃ­ses Baixos x Espanha em
direto e ao minuto.

author: H.G.
title: Gaza: des soldats israÃ©liens avaient entendu des appels au secours des otages tuÃ©s par erreur
text:
Trois otages israÃ©liens ont Ã©tÃ© abattus par erreur Ã  Gaza Ã  la mi-dÃ©cembre. Le chef du gouvernement Benjamin Netanyahu avait dit regretter "une insupportable tragÃ©die". Des soldats israÃ©liens se trouvaient dans le mÃªme bÃ¢timent que trois otages abattus par erreur Ã  Gaza et avaient entendu leurs appels au secours en hÃ©breu cinq jours avant les faits, selon les conclusions d'une enquÃªte de l'armÃ©e publiÃ©es jeudi.
Le 10 dÃ©cembre, prenant d'assaut un bÃ¢timent, des soldats ont entendu ces appels, "otages" et "au secours!" criÃ©s en hÃ©breu. Mais ils ont cru Ã  un stratagÃ¨me de combattants du Hamas pour leur tendre un piÃ¨ge dans cet immeuble situÃ© Ã  Choujaiya, dans l'est de la ville de Gaza .
Pensant ce bÃ¢timent piÃ©gÃ© par des explosifs, les soldats en sont sortis. Cinq combattants du Hamas qui gardaient les otages ont ensuite Ã©tÃ© tuÃ©s par des tirs d'hÃ©licoptÃ¨res israÃ©liens en tentant de s'Ã©loigner de l'immeuble, rÃ©vÃ¨le l'enquÃªte.
Les otages ont ensuite "probablement" fui le bÃ¢timent, selon les investigations.
Deux mois au coeur du conflit entre le Hamas et IsraÃ«l 24:07 Les trois otages brandissaient un drapeau blanc Cinq jours plus tard, des soldats israÃ©liens leur ont tirÃ© dessus, aprÃ¨s les avoir "identifiÃ©s comme des menaces". Deux ont Ã©tÃ© tuÃ©s sur le coup. Le troisiÃ¨me s'est enfui et d'aprÃ¨s l'enquÃªte, les soldats ont alors eu ordre de ne pas tirer afin de l'identifier.
Le commandant du bataillon, entendant des cris en hÃ©breu, "au secours!" et "ils me tirent dessus!", a demandÃ© Ã  l'otage survivant d'avancer vers eux, rÃ©pÃ©tant Ã  ses troupes de ne pas tirer.
Mais deux soldats, "qui n'ont pas entendu l'ordre Ã  cause du bruit d'un char Ã  proximitÃ©", l'ont abattu. Les trois otages Ã©taient torse-nu et brandissaient un drapeau blanc.
"L'armÃ©e a failli Ã  sa mission" La veille de l'incident, le 14 dÃ©cembre, un drone de l'armÃ©e avait identifiÃ© des inscriptions sur un bÃ¢timent Ã  200m de l'endroit oÃ¹ les trois otages ont Ã©tÃ© tuÃ©s: "SOS" et "Ã  l'aide, trois otages".
"L'armÃ©e a failli Ã  sa mission de secourir les otages", a indiquÃ© dans un communiquÃ© le chef d'Ã©tat-major de l'armÃ©e israÃ©lienne, le gÃ©nÃ©ral Herzi Halevi. Les tirs sur les trois otages "auraient pu Ãªtre Ã©vitÃ©s", a-t-il ajoutÃ©. Le chef du gouvernement, Benjamin Netanyahu, avait dit regretter "une insupportable tragÃ©die", plongeant "tout l'Etat d'IsraÃ«l dans le deuil".
Les victimes sont Yotam HaÃ¯m, un batteur de Heavy Metal de 28 ans, et Samer al-Talalqa, un BÃ©douin de 25 ans, tous deux enlevÃ©s au kibboutz Nir Am lors de l'attaque meurtriÃ¨re du Hamas dans le sud d'IsraÃ«l le 7 octobre.
Sur le mÃªme sujet Attaques en IsraÃ«l: qui sont les trois FranÃ§ais disparus ou otages du Hamas depuis 82 jours? Le troisiÃ¨me otage tuÃ© est Alon Lulu Shamriz, 26 ans, habitant du kibboutz Kfar Aza. Quelque 250 personnes ont Ã©tÃ© prises en otage lors de l'attaque du Hamas. A ce jour, 129 sont toujours retenues Ã  Gaza, d'aprÃ¨s les autoritÃ©s israÃ©liennes.
dossier : Attaques du 7 octobre 2023 du Hamas contre IsraÃ«l

author: Manuel Castro
title: El Musel tendrÃ¡ la mayor piscifactorÃ­a de Europa con el proyecto de Sea Eight - La Nueva EspaÃ±a
text: El Musel tendrÃ¡ la mayor piscifactorÃ­a de Europa con el proyecto de Sea Eight La compaÃ±Ã­a ultima la construcciÃ³n del primero de sus siete edificios en el Puerto y pretende duplicar la inversiÃ³n que habÃ­a previsto hace tres aÃ±os El puerto de El Musel albergarÃ¡ la mayor piscifactorÃ­a de Europa cuando se complete el proyecto inversor que estÃ¡ desarrollando la empresa Sea Eight, que ultima la construcciÃ³n de su primer edificio para el engorde de lenguados en la explanada de La Figar. AdemÃ¡s de los 10.000 metros cuadrados que ya tiene en concesiÃ³n, la compaÃ±Ã­a prevÃ© solicitar otros 30.000 mÃ¡s para levantar otros cinco edificios de mayores dimensiones que el actual. No solo eso, sino que tambiÃ©n ha trasladado a la Autoridad Portuaria de GijÃ³n su interÃ©s por hacerse con la concesiÃ³n de un edificio portuario actualmente en desuso. Si hace tres aÃ±os la compaÃ±Ã­a preveÃ­a invertir en GijÃ³n 73 millones de euros, esa cifra casi se duplica con la revisiÃ³n al alza de su proyecto, que alcanzarÃ¡ los 140,4 millones de euros. El edificio que constituye la primera fase del proyecto, con una inversiÃ³n de 12,4 millones de euros, estarÃ¡ concluido en diciembre y en enero comenzarÃ¡n a llegar desde el criadero que tiene la empresa en Portugal los primeros alevines de lenguado para su engorde en los 96 tanques de 42 metros de largo por 2,5 de ancho que albergarÃ¡ el inmueble. Esta inversiÃ³n cuenta con una ayuda concedida por la DirecciÃ³n General de Pesca MarÃ­tima del Principado del 30% de la convocatoria de 2023 del Fondo Europeo de Mar, Pesca y Acuicultura. El pasado miÃ©rcoles el proyecto de Sea Eight en El Musel tambiÃ©n recibiÃ³ el espaldarazo del Ministro de Agricultura, Pesca y AlimentaciÃ³n, Luis Planas, quien visitÃ³ las obras junto a autoridades autonÃ³micas y locales, que recibieron informaciÃ³n sobre el desarrollo del proyecto. Los otros cinco edificios que va a construir en La Figar, en sucesivas fases de un proyecto planificado a largo plazo, tendrÃ¡n una altura mÃ¡s que el actual y tambiÃ©n la planta del edificio serÃ¡ mayor. La segunda fase del proyecto serÃ¡ un nuevo edificio prÃ³ximo al actual, en el que se prevÃ©n invertir 29 millones de euros y que darÃ­a empleo a 60 trabajadores, el doble de los que se contratarÃ¡ en la primera fase. AdemÃ¡s del engorde de lenguados, la empresa tambiÃ©n proyecta dar valor aÃ±adido al producto con el fileteado y envasado en bandeja del mismo. El proyecto no sÃ³lo crece en inversiÃ³n respecto al inicial, sino que la compaÃ±Ã­a tambiÃ©n va a criar lenguados en uno de esos 7 edificios, destinando los otros a los tanques de engorde y otras tareas. Con el primer edificio que pondrÃ¡ en servicio en enero en El Musel, Sea Eight prevÃ© alcanzar las 450 toneladas anuales de producciÃ³n. A esas se sumarÃ¡n otras 840 toneladas cuando se construya el segundo edificio. Una vez que el proyecto estÃ© completado, la previsiÃ³n de la empresa es alcanzar una producciÃ³n anual de 4.000 toneladas, dando empleo a 260 trabajadores. Antes de que Sea Eight se embarque en la construcciÃ³n de su segundo edificio en La Figar, es previsible que solicite en concesiÃ³n la edificaciÃ³n portuaria por la que ya se ha interesado, procediendo a adecuarla a sus necesidades. Sea Eight, que ya cuenta con varias piscifactorÃ­as de lenguado en EspaÃ±a y Portugal, estÃ¡ exportando ya parte de su producciÃ³n a otros paÃ­ses europeos y comenzando a abrir mercado la costa este de EE UU. AdemÃ¡s de tratarse de una actividad sostenible, la crÃ­a y engorde de lenguados no compite con los pescadores locales. Se trata de una especie que se captura fundamentalmente en el Mar del Norte. Su pesca, a la que se dedican embarcaciones del norte de Europa, es actualmente de unas 16.000 toneladas anuales, frente a las 30.000 de hace unos aÃ±os. Muy por debajo en ambos casos de las 100.000 toneladas anuales de consumo en Europa, segÃºn el estudio de mercado realizado por la empresa. El procedimiento para la crÃ­a de lenguados que ha desarrollado Sea Eight tiene un componente tecnolÃ³gico, con selecciÃ³n genÃ©tica y fertilizaciones in vitro, automatizaciÃ³n del bombeo del agua de mar, que se tomarÃ¡ del CantÃ¡brico por la parte exterior del Muelle de La Osa y pasarÃ¡ por un sistema de depuraciÃ³n antes de llegar a los tanques en los que estÃ¡n los peces. Se emplearÃ¡ un sistema de recirculaciÃ³n del agua, para minimizar la que se capte del CantÃ¡brico y la que se vierta, previa depuraciÃ³n tambiÃ©n, al interior de El Musel. Mediante sistemas de visiÃ³n artificial se irÃ¡ controlando el engorde de los peces, sus calidades y tambiÃ©n aquellos casos en los que por cualquier circunstancia hubiera que prestar especial atenciÃ³n a algÃºn ejemplar. AdemÃ¡s, el anÃ¡lisis de los parÃ¡metros fÃ­sico quÃ­micos del agua. Apuntes - El proyecto. Contempla construir seis edificios en 40.000 m2 de la explanada de La Figar y solicitar en concesiÃ³n un sÃ©ptimo actualmente vacante en El Musel. La inversiÃ³n conjunta alcanzarÃ¡ los 140,4 millones de euros, dando empleo a 260 trabajadores y con una producciÃ³n de 4.000 toneladas anuales de lenguado. - Engorde y crÃ­a. AdemÃ¡s de aumentar la capacidad de engorde de lenguados respecto al proyecto inicial, la empresa tambiÃ©n ha decidido ubicar en uno de los edificios un criadero de lenguados. - Pesca. El proyecto no compite con el sector pesquero asturiano, dado que el lenguado salvaje se captura en el Mar del Norte, por parte de flotas de otros paÃ­ses. author: Shanila Kabir
title: Families flood malls the day after Christmas to return unwanted gifts
text:
Families flood malls the day after Christmas to return unwanted gifts Shanila Kabir Thu, December 26, 2024 at 9:16 PM UTC 2 min read
The day after Christmas is informally known as â€œNational Return Day.â€ Although returns are fairly common throughout the year, they are much more prevalent during the holidays- especially directly after Christmas.
>>> STREAM ACTION NEWS JAX LIVE <<<
[DOWNLOAD: Free Action News Jax app for alerts as news breaks ]
Many are expected to flood stores today to return or exchange the unwanted gifts they received yesterday.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement â€œI came to the Avenues Mall in Jacksonville because I needed to exchange a few shirts for my grandsons,â€ said Vicki Burns.
According to the National Retail Federation, store owners expect returns to be 17% higher right now.
â€œI donâ€™t blame people. If youâ€™re not going to use it or if it doesnâ€™t fit, itâ€™s better to put it right back so somebody else might buy it,â€ said Brenda Smith, a St. George, Georgia resident.
The National Retail Federation states that 2024 will total out with $890 billion worth of returned merchandise. Today is expected to be a good chunk of that overall projection. However, many shoppers told Action News Jax that December 26th can also mean more shopping at half of the price.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Jacksonville resident, Forrest Sherrill said he rushed to the Avenues Mall to grab a birthday gift for his wife and to check out after Christmas sales.
Our consumer advisor Clark Howard suggests waiting until the new year, specifically the first week of January to return items you do not need or want. He said you will avoid the crowds and long lines, and possibly take advantage of merchandise at marked down prices. He also advises you not to wait too long, with many retailers enforcing stricter return policies and deadlines.
The NRF expects sales this holiday season to be almost 3% higher than in 2023.
if you are at the mall to shop, return items or do bothâ€” retail experts say 2024 will set another holiday shopping record.

author: Grace O'Connor - Health & Science Editor
title: Hidden Food Dangers: Health & Nutrition Risks
text:
Dietary Concerns Rise in Taiwan: Popular foods and Potential Health Risks A growing number of health professionals in Taiwan are raising concerns about the potential long-term health consequences of consuming certain widely popular foods. These concerns center around the frequency and quantity of intake, suggesting a link too several prevalent health issues facing the nation.
The Hidden Costs of Familiar Flavors Recent analyses indicate that dietary habits in Taiwan often involve consumption levels of specific food groups that significantly exceed recommended guidelines. This overconsumption is believed to contribute to an increased risk of not only chronic diseases but also more immediate health problems. While pinpointing specific culprits varies across studies, a recurring theme highlights the dangers associated with processed meats and excessive sugar intake â€“ frequently found in beloved Taiwanese breakfast staples and snack foods.
According to the Taiwan Ministry of Health and Welfare, cardiovascular disease remains the leading cause of death,accounting for nearly 30% of all fatalities in 2024. Experts believe dietary factors play a considerable role in this statistic.
Understanding the Core Issues Nutritionists emphasize that the risks arenâ€™t always immediately obvious. The detrimental effects often accumulate gradually over years, making these foods especially insidious.As one expert put it, â€œThe health risks arenâ€™t immediately apparent,leading to these foods being dubbed â€˜invisible killers.â€™ Damage accumulates over time, contributing to chronic diseases.â€ This slow-burn impact makes it tough for individuals to connect their dietary choices with developing health problems.
Hereâ€™s a breakdown of the key concerns:
Frequency and Quantity: The sheer volume of consumption is a major factor. Many individuals are consuming these perhaps harmful foods on a daily basis, far surpassing what is considered healthy. Chronic Disease Connection: Several reports suggest a direct correlation between the overconsumption of these foods and Taiwanâ€™s top ten causes of death, including heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer. Neurological and Peripheral Impacts: Beyond the generalized risk of chronic illness, emerging research suggests potential links to neurological issues and conditions affecting the extremities, such as peripheral neuropathy. The Silent Accumulation of Damage: â€œExcessive Consumption: Nutritionists emphasize that the frequency and quantity of consumption are critical.â€ This consistent exposure to harmful ingredients can lead to a gradual decline in overall health. Practical Steps Towards a Healthier Diet The goal isnâ€™t necessarily complete elimination, but rather a shift towards moderation and mindful eating.Rather of viewing these foods as forbidden, consider them occasional treats rather than daily staples. Think of it like managing screen time â€“ a little is acceptable, but constant exposure can be detrimental.
Here are some actionable steps you can take:
Reduce Processed Meat Consumption: Actively seek alternatives to processed meats like sausages, bacon, and ham. Consider lean protein sources such as fish, poultry, or plant-based options. Be sugar Aware: Pay close attention to the sugar content of beverages and snacks.Many seemingly healthy options are loaded with hidden sugars. Read labels carefully. Embrace Whole Foods: Prioritize a diet rich in whole, unprocessed foods like fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. Seek Professional guidance: â€œFor personalized dietary advice, consider consulting a registered nutritionist.â€ A qualified nutritionist can help you develop a tailored eating plan that meets your individual needs and health goals. The current discourse emphasizes the importance of proactive health management. By making informed dietary choices, individuals can significantly reduce their risk of developing serious health problems and contribute to a healthier future for Taiwan.

author: Josh Alper
title: Drake London limited in practice, says he's good for Sunday night - NBC Sports
text:
Drake London limited in practice, says heâ€™s good for Sunday night
The Falcons should have wide receiver Drake London in the lineup on Sunday as they continue to work their way toward an NFC South title.
London was listed as a limited participant in practice on Thursday because of a knee injury, but he told reporters, via Marc Raimondi of ESPN.com, that [he will be fine](https://x.com/marcraimondi/status/1872357127983149125) for this weekendâ€™s game against the Commanders. The team will issue their final injury report for Sunday nightâ€™s game on Friday.
Cornerbacks Kevin King (concussion) and Antonio Hamilton (quad) were the only Falcons to miss practice entirely on Thursday.
Linebacker Lorenzo Carter (groin), wide receiver KhaDarel Hodge (ribs), linebacker Nate Landman (rest), tight end Ross Dwelley (ankle), tight end Charlie Woerner (rest), and defensive lineman Zach Harrison (Achilles) were also listed as limited participants. Wide receiver Casey Washington (concussion) is a full participant.
